data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: Jimmy Donaldson, the 25-year-old American YouTuber better known as 'MrBeast', has bought an entire neighbourhood in the US for himself, his family and his employees, New York Post reported. In the last couple of years, he purchased at least five homes in the area. He purchased his own home when it went up for sale in 2018 for about $320,000.
data.title: 25-yr-old YouTuber MrBeast buys out US neighbourhood for employees

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: WhatsApp has released a statement amid increasing complaints from users regarding scam calls from international numbers. "We have a grievance officer...in India who can be contacted if a user has a concern about their experience," WhatsApp told CNBC-TV18. WhatsApp applies spam detection technology to spot and take action on accounts engaging in abnormal behaviour to stop spam, it added.
data.title: WhatsApp responds to international calls scam, says 'contact our grievance officer'

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: Tesla CEO and the world's second-richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "WhatsApp cannot be trusted." He tweeted this in response to a Twitter engineer's claim that WhatsApp had been using his mobile phone's microphone in the background while he was asleep and since he woke up at 6 am. Musk's tweet comes amid a widespread WhatsApp scam involving international numbers.
data.title: WhatsApp cannot be trusted: Elon Musk

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: The US Virgin Islands government claimed it has not been able to locate Google's billionaire Co-founder Larry Page to serve a subpoena for his alleged links to JPMorgan Chase and late sex criminal Jeffrey Epstein. The government made "good-faith attempts", including hiring an investigative firm to search public records databases. Reportedly, the Virgin Islands is now seeking to serve Alphabet.
data.title: Unable to find Google Co-founder Larry Page: US Virgin Islands in Epstein case

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: Union Minister of Electronics and IT Ashwini Vaishnaw took to Twitter to share that he met Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai at the company's headquarters on Tuesday. Sharing a picture with Pichai, Vaishnaw wrote, "Good discussion on India Stack and Make in India program." The IT Minister, who's currently in California, met with the leadership of SEMI earlier today.
data.title: 'Met Sundar Pichai at Google HQ,' tweets IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw; shares pic

data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: Cyberabad Police has warned people not to respond to calls from unknown international numbers on WhatsApp. "We request everyone to remain vigilant...Please report and block them immediately, as it is a scam designed to lure people," Cyberabad Police tweeted. Most of these calls are being made from numbers starting with +60 (Malaysia), +62 (Indonesia), +254 (Kenya), and +84 (Vietnam).
data.title: Don't respond to international calls on WhatsApp, it's a scam: Cyberabad Police

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: The government has asked manufacturers to ensure that all mobile phones should come equipped with a built-in radio receiver. "If the FM Radio receiver function or feature is not available in mobile phones, it may be included," the government advisory said. "FM stations serve as important communication links between the local authorities and people during natural disasters," the government added.
data.title: FM radio compulsory on all mobile phones: Govt to manufacturers

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday took to Twitter to share an article titled 'The 2020 Election Wasn’t Stolen, It Was Bought By Mark Zuckerberg'. Musk tweeted, "Interesting article. Perhaps Community Notes can add further context & corrections." The article claimed that Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg privatised the government's voter registration and vote counting for Democrats in 2020.
data.title: Interesting: Musk on article saying 'Zuckerberg bought 2020 US elections'

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: WhatsApp is rolling out an update for the WhatsApp Web beta testers and releasing a feature that allows users to edit messages, WABetaInfo reported. The 'edit message' feature is available in the menu for options for a text message. Users get up to 15 minutes to edit their messages and it is possible to edit messages multiple times.
data.title: WhatsApp launches edit message feature for some web users

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Zomato shares slumped over 5% as government-backed Open Network for Digital Commerce entered the food delivery market. ONDC, which lets restaurants sell food directly to consumers without the need for a third party, has breached the 10,000 daily order mark. People are taking to Twitter to share screenshots comparing ONDC's prices with Swiggy and Zomato and saying ONDC costs cheaper.
data.title: Zomato shares fall as govt-backed ONDC enters food delivery market

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak in an interview with CNN discussing AI and concerns raised around it said, "If you want a study of AI gone wrong and taking a lot of claims and trying to kill you every chance it can, get a Tesla." He added he believed claims made by Tesla earlier, adding, "It's not even close to reality."
data.title: Get Tesla if you want to see how AI can go wrong: Apple Co-founder

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: Ishan Wahi, a 32-year-old Indian man, has been sentenced to two years in prison in the US for insider trading. The ex-manager at Coinbase shared information about which digital assets would be listed on the crypto exchange with his brother and friend to make $1.5 million, as per prosecutors. Wahi pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit wire fraud in February.
data.title: Indian man gets 2 years jail in US in crypto insider trading case

data.author: Ananya Goyal
data.content: Apple failed to fully revive a copyright lawsuit against security startup Corellium over its software that simulates iPhone's iOS operating system, letting researchers identify flaws in it. Corellium's simulator is protected by copyright law's fair use doctrine, an appeals court said. It however added that it should be seen if Corellium infringed copyrights covering Apple's icons and wallpapers.
data.title: Apple loses bid to revive US copyright claims over iOS simulation

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: Mobile World Congress (MWC) organiser GSMA has been fined €200,000 by Spain's data protection watchdog over use of facial recognition system during MWC 2021. GSMA had offered attendees the option to use the biometric system to enter the venue. The watchdog said GSMA violated the General Data Protection Regulation and failed to conduct due diligence in the matter.
data.title: Mobile World Congress host fined €200,000 over biometric checks

data.author: Ananya Goyal
data.content: Intel on Monday confirmed plans to cut its workforce to reduce costs, but declined to share how many workers would be affected. This comes after Intel reported a net loss of $2.8 billion in Q1 last month, its largest-ever quarterly loss. Earlier this year, it cut management pay across the company, with CEO Pat Gelsinger taking a 25% cut.
data.title: Intel announces layoffs after posting largest-ever quarterly loss

data.author: Srishty Choudhury
data.content: Taiwanese tech giant Foxconn has bought a 300-acre land for approximately ₹300 crore ($37 million) in Karnataka's Bengaluru, London Stock Exchange filings showed. The purchase was done on behalf of its subsidiary Foxconn Hon Hai Technology India Mega Development, AFP reported. The move comes as the company, Apple iPhone parts' biggest supplier, looks to diversify production away from China.
data.title: iPhone maker Foxconn buys 300-acre land in Bengaluru for ₹300 cr

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: A US judge has dismissed a proposed class action lawsuit accusing Twitter of targeting female employees during layoffs that took place after billionaire Elon Musk acquired the social media platform in 2022. The judge said the lawsuit was "devoid of basic information". He added that plaintiffs will be allowed to amend the lawsuit to add more details.
data.title: Suit claiming Musk's Twitter firing targeted women dismissed in US

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: Google is paying The New York Times (NYT) about $100 million over three years as part of a content deal announced earlier this year, The Wall Street Journal reported. As per the report, the deal will let Google feature the publication's content on some of its platforms. In February, NYT said it'd work with Google on content distribution and subscriptions.
data.title: Google to pay New York Times $100 million for content: Report

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: The Supreme Court has granted a stay on the ₹200 crore penalty imposed on Amazon by Competition Commission of India (CCI) in Amazon-Future Group deal case. In 2021, CCI had suspended the 2019 deal, noting that Amazon failed to notify strategic interest in Future Retail Limited. SC has directed that no coercive steps be taken against Amazon till next hearing.
data.title: SC stays Amazon's ₹200 cr penalty in Amazon-Future Group deal case

data.author: Ashley Paul
data.content: Artificial intelligence (AI) won't replace people because it lacks emotion, said Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak. AI will, however, make bad actors even more convincing because programmes like ChatGPT can create text which "sounds so intelligent", he added. AI could make scams and misinformation harder to spot, he said, adding, "A human really has to take responsibility for what AI generates."
data.title: AI won't replace people as it lacks emotion: Apple Co-founder

data.author: Ananya Goyal
data.content: Collapsed crypto exchange FTX's Founder Sam Bankman-Fried, in his first detailed legal defence since prosecutors accused him of fraud, asked a US judge to dismiss 10 of the 13 criminal counts against him. Prosecutors turned regulatory issues into federal crimes, his lawyers said, arguing that FTX wasn't the only crypto firm to collapse during a broad market crash in 2022.
data.title: FTX Founder seeks dismissal of 10 criminal charges against him

data.author: Ananya Goyal
data.content: AI could replace 80% of human jobs in the next few years, cognitive scientist and SingularityNET's CEO Ben Goertzel said. "Not with ChatGPT exactly as a product. But with systems of that nature...which are going to follow," Goertzel stated, adding, "I don't think it's a threat...People can find better things to do with their life than work for a living."
data.title: AI could replace 80% of jobs in next few years: SingularityNET CEO

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: Japan's Mitsubishi Electric's India unit will build a manufacturing facility in Tamil Nadu with an investment of about $231 million. The company will hire more than 2,000 people for the project, Reuters reported citing an official statement. Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin is set to visit Japan and Singapore this month for inviting industrialists to Global Investors Meet in Chennai.
data.title: Japan's Mitsubishi Electric to set up $231-mn plant in Tamil Nadu

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: Google's DeepMind trained a couple of miniature humanoid robots to play football using AI. Researchers initially trained virtual versions of robots before transferring the technology to real ones. The robots "exhibit robust and dynamic movement skills" such as rapid fall recovery and kicking, DeepMind said, adding that they've also "developed a basic strategic understanding of the game".
data.title: Robots use AI developed by Google's DeepMind to play football

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: ONDC CEO T Koshy has said the platform will be driven by competition and fair practices and not unhealthy discounting. "Participants do agree with our philosophy that we should nurture a sustainable network building on cost economics resulting from specialisation and innovation," he said. The government-backed network breached the 10,000 daily order mark earlier this month.
data.title: ONDC will be not be driven by unhealthy discounting: CEO
